frame.name: Temporal_pattern
frame.definition:
<def-root>A salient <fen>Subevent</fen> has a <fen>Pattern</fen> of recurrence within a larger <fen>Process</fen>.
<ex>Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Process
FE.definition:
<def-root>The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
<ex>The <t>rhythm</t> <fex name="pr">of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subevent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
<ex>His <t>rhythmic</t> <fex name="se">tapping</fex> irritated her</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the Pattern in which the Subevents recur.
<ex>I could feel the <fex name="dsc">steady</fex> <t>rhythm</t> of his breathing</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Pattern
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> . <ex>The music had a driving <t>rhythm</t></ex> <ex>The music had a driving <fex name="pt">rhythm</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>An indication of a conventionally recognized subtype that the <fen>Pattern</fen> belongs to.
<ex>Herminio illustrated a <fex name="tp">rhumba</fex> <t>rhythm</t> on the congas</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rhythm.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a recurrent pattern, especially of sound or movement

lexUnit.name: beat.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a regular, strongly punctuated pattern in music

lexUnit.name: time.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the rhythm of a song
